I believe in starting small and growing
column4: in doing as much as I can--regardless of how small--to make  this world a better place. (18 of 20)

text: ...but for these 15 children and their families
column4: we offer a path to success. (17 of 20)

text: Here is a way to do something life-changing for these Syrian refugees. It does not solve the crisis--not even close (16 of 20)
Many of us have watched in horror as the Syrian refugee crisis unfolded. We have felt helpless. (15 of 20)
We welcome Reem and Abdullah and Mohammed and Maher and Abla and the others to the family. (14 of 20)
Fugees Academy's curriculum is designed to meet his needs. Our current students are thriving at Fugees Academy. (13 of 20)
He recently tested to be placed in 7th grade at his zoned public middle school. He  is being set up for  failure. (12 of 20)
What would happen if we weren't here doing this work? One of the children
column4: Abdullah
column5: has been in the U.S. for 10 months.  (11 of 20)

text: at a level that will encourage them to learn and flourish
column4: not become more  overwhelmed
column5: confused

text: Their results put them below a  kindergarten level. These Syrian children need 1-2 years of immersion & support
column4: in a small class (9 of 20)

text: After we evaluated them
column4: my heart broke again. They could sing along to the ABC's
column5: but not one of them could write all 26 letters. (8 of 20)

text: ...comfort that the person in charge of this school so far away from home was one of them.  (7 of 20)
They asked if I was Syrian
column4: and I told them that yes
column5: my mom was born there.  Glimmers of hope

text: and quickly switched to Arabic when I saw how lost they looked. Their faces lit up. (5 of 20)
Frail & scared
column4: the recent trauma of war visible in their eyes. I expalined the application & testing process for new students (4 of 20)

text: as Syrian families approached our door
column4: hoping to be accepted as new students. Most had been in the U.S. for less than two months. (3 of 20)

text: In my 12 years of working with refugees in the U.S.
column4: I haven't seen anything as gut  wrenching as what happened this summer (2 of 20)

text: This is the week of school for Fugees Family
column4: and the beginning of a new life for 15 Syrian children. (1 of 20)
